titleStmt.title: The Proceedings and judgment against the rioters ... who were fined at the Kings bench court at Westminster on the 26th of this instant June, 1683, for a riot and battery committed by them upon ... the late Lord Mayor, &c. in Guild Hall, at the election of sheriffs ... : as also the fining of one Mr. Turne, for making a riot upon the Mayor of Rye, in the county of Sussex.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Court of King's Bench.

titleStmt.title: The Proceedings and judgment against the rioters ... who were fined at the Kings bench court at Westminster on the 26th of this instant June, 1683, for a riot and battery committed by them upon ... the late Lord Mayor, &c. in Guild Hall, at the election of sheriffs ... : as also the fining of one Mr. Turne, for making a riot upon the Mayor of Rye, in the county of Sussex.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Court of King's Bench.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
The riot was to oppose the election of the new sheriffs. The Lord Mayor was Sir John Moore. cf. Crawford, J.L.L. Catalogue of English Broadsides, 1505-1897.
